general_advisory: Based on five days weather forecast received from IMD, farmers can resume agronomic practices, application pesticides and fertilizers from Thursday. Apply balanced and appropriate fertilizers according to crop’s growth stage. Avoid excess nitrogen as it promotes excessive vegetative growth and increases water demand.

advisory: Apply 16kg Urea + 10kg MOP per acre in upland condition and 20kg urea + 13kg MOP per acre in medium and low land condition at panicle initiation stage as second top dressing.
Install Pheromone traps @ 8nos./acre and light trap @1no./acre to monitor and control the population of stem borer, leaf folder and rice ear eating caterpillar and replace the lure after three weeks.
In stem borer endemic areas, release egg parasitoid Tritrichogramma japonicum (Tricho card) @ 60000 eggs (3 card) /acre is required.
Current weather may favour blast disease in rice. To control it spray Tebuconazole 50% WG.
Leaf webber: Spray Profenophos 50% EC or Chlorpyriphos 50 % + Cypermethrin 5 % EC.
Wilt: Wilting may be observed after receding of rain. Apply Metiram 75% WG @ 1.5g/liter at root zone of the plant as control measure.
Stem borer, FAW and banded leaf and sheath blight may appear due to present weather condition. Monitor the field regularly and remove infected plant parts.
To control Fall army worm spray Emamectin benzoate 5% SG or Chlorantraniliprole 18.5% SC.
For effective control of stem borer spray Fipronil 5% SC or Profenophos 50% EC.
BLSB: Soaked, discolored concentric bands and rings on leaves and sheaths. For control, spray Validamycin 3.0% SL or Hexaconazole 5% EC.
To control wilt, spray Tebuconazole 25.9% EC + Streptocycline at the root zone mixed with water.
To manage Phomopsis blight disease, spray Metalaxyl 8%+ Mancozeb 64 % WP or Propineb 70 % WP.
In bhindi fruit and shoot borer infestation occurs at fruit formation stage. To control the fruit and shoot borer infestation spray Emamectin benzoate 5% SG or Flubendiamide 39.35 SC.
To control papaya leaf curl virus, install yellow sticky trap @ 8nos/acre and spray neem oil (1500 ppm).
To manage Sigatoka leaf spot and Cigar end rot or Tip rot spray Mancozeb 75% WP.
As grasses are high in moisture content during rainy days, the cattle don’t get adequate dry matter from those. So, give 1 kg if concentrate for every 2 kg of milk to dairy animals.
